comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry for him in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cornelius_Judson_Bushnell

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The sources are confusing. www.thefullwiki.org/Cornelius_Judson_Bushnell says that this is Cornelius Judson Bushnell (September 20, 1855 - ?), son of Cornelius Scranton Bushnell and treasurer of the Brunswick and Birmingham Railroad. www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=94955677 says that he was a prominent baritone in New York. The obituary of Cornelius Scranton Bushnell in The New York Times, May 7, 1896 (query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F00610F6395A16...) indicates also that his son, named Judson Bushnell, was a singer and musician. On the other hand, Cornelius Judson Bushnell would be 55 years old in 1910 and the photograph must have been taken much earlier. And there is a C. J. Bushnell mentonned in The Lynden tribune., June 13, 1918, Page 7 (chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88085445/1918-06-13/ed-...), described as Instructor at Pennsylvania Military College and Special Instructor of the Officers' Reserve Training Corps for the U. S. Army, who bears much resemblance to the person on the Bain photograph.

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: B-59 he does look similar to the picture in the newspaper article.  We will look further into this before making any changes to the source data.  Thanks for the information.
